hypothesis_content.title: Altcoin Fear Spillover Rebound
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL/BULL regimes, when BTC experiences a sharp, high-volume down day (-5% or more) driven by negative traditional market news (e.g., 'traditional market froth' concerns), but the BTC Dominance index (BTC.D) *declines* on the same day, select high-quality altcoins (top 30 by market cap, excluding stablecoins) will outperform BTC over the following 48 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: A BTC sell-off driven by external macro fears, paired with declining dominance, suggests rotation, not broad crypto risk-off. Money may be moving from BTC to alts as a 'risk-on' bet within the crypto complex. This is a contrarian play against the initial headline panic.
entry_conditions: Regime is NEUTRAL or BULL (per FjordHQ classifier)
BTC daily return <= -5% on volume > 1.2x 20-day average
News sentiment analysis shows dominant narrative is traditional market spillover (non-crypto-native)
BTC Dominance (daily close) is LOWER than its open on the same down day
ETH/BTC daily close is flat or up (confirms altcoin relative strength)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Altcoin basket (equal weight top 30) achieves a 2% outperformance vs. BTC
exit_conditions.time_exit: 48 hours after entry (close of 2nd trading day)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The median altcoin (top 30) return net of BTC return over the 48-hour window is not statistically greater than zero. A majority of signals result in the stop-loss being hit before the take-profit.
